page.title: 08Clubs
page.content: The block is too sparsely populated to support clubs on its own. Residents do in some cases join groups based in Inverurie. There are many groups in Inverurie such as would be found in most Scots towns such as WRI's and church - based clubs. Of special note however are a group known as The Baillies of Bennachie, a group of volunteers who protect the local mountain which lies outside the block to the north, but which visually dominates the area. The Baillies try to control pollution and litter on the Bennachie hill range and to educate visitors. Several block residents belong to this association.
